page.title: 02Pubs
page.content: {The Bell, Main St.}is the only working pub left in Frisby. Dating back to 1759 it is a freehouse. Meals are served. Darts and skittles are played. {The Black Horse}is a disused coaching inn built in the 1792, when all local traffic went through Frisby before a turnpike was built in 1810. A private house since 1974 the only signs of its previous use are the coach entrance, cobbled yard, cellar and the inn sign which was still in the house. Some original windows were blocked in to avoid window tax (1696-1851), modern ones have been installed. There was another alehouse{The Star.}Now Old Star Cottage, Main Street.{Flying Childers named after a local racehorse and situated on the A607, 3 miles from Melton. Thus Sunday "travellers" could stop here(1910's) avoiding drink laws.
